title: Text Signal and Mathematical Analysis Strategies for Understanding Second Language Science Explanatory Texts

context.prior_knowledge: Basic English reading comprehension, understanding of fundamental science concepts, and foundational mathematical skills (graph interpretation, basic statistics)
context.additional_context: Course for mathematics professionals to improve English scientific document interpretation skills. Emphasis on smartphone-based learning activities in limited-technology environments. Focus on data visualization (graphs, charts) analysis and integration of numerical information.

learning_goals: Apply reading comprehension strategies for second-language scientific texts using textual cues (headings, underlining) and mathematical analysis (graphs, tables) with over 80% accuracy.

Demonstrate content structure analysis skills based on title-underline relevance and physical distance through mathematical modeling (spatial arrangement, pattern recognition) in project deliverables.
Achieve at least 75% proficiency in extracting information from textual cues and integrating statistical analysis (mean, deviation calculation) in formative assessments.

constraints.tech_requirements: Limited tech environment (no PC, smartphone only)

difficulty: Moderate - Standard complexity with some constraints
